Welcome *******
Welcome to the OpenAMQ website. OpenAMQ is a commodity middleware platform that implements an industry-standard protocol - AMQP - as a high-performance server and client API.
The Advanced Message Queues Protocol (AMQP) ===========================================
AMQP is a standardised wire-protocol for high-performance message exchange between a server and a set of clients. It supports the standard models of point-to-point queuing, publish-subscribe, and file-transfer, in a modern and language-independent manner.
See: [/protocol.html:The AMQ protocol]
The OpenAMQ Server ===================
This is a fast open source implementation of AMQP that runs on all modern platforms (Linux, Win32, Solaris, other Unixes). OpenAMQ is written in ANSI C and is highly configurable for specific messaging scenarios or memory/performance constraints.
See: [/server.html:The OpenAMQ server]
The OpenAMQ Clients ===================
Whatever your preferred language, you will find an OpenAMQ library or API that gives you seamless access to AMQP services. Most of the OpenAMQ clients use the standard JMS (Java Messaging Services) model, with extensions. It typically takes 1-2 days to start using OpenAMQ in your applications.
Since AMQP is an open standard, you can write your own client layers. The average effort is about 10-20 days.
See: [/clients.html:The AMQP clients]
